job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Seattle, WA
pros: Family like environment, great coworkers, management listens to staff concerns, good pay, comfortable work environment and realistic expectations in workload, not for profit, really cares for patients

pros: Good working environment: staff are very supportive, caring and easily approachable, even the CEO, COO, CFO, Administrator, and DNS. Every one does their job and helps you if needed. It's a fun place to work. We have a feeling we are all on one team. The residents are all treated royally no matter their income.
cons: I wish it was closer to my home.

review_title: Strongly recommend Kline Galland Home Health
pros: Great coworkers; collaborative despite being in the home health setting. Managers who listen and help solve problems clinicians have in the field. Hourly rate is far better than most outpatient PT clinics. Productivity requirements are very reasonable.
cons: PTO leaves something to be desired, but doesn’t dissuade me from working here; too many pros.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Seattle, WA
pros: Caring management Willing to make changes based on employee feedback Make your own schedule Supportive and collaborative team members Patient needs valued
cons: On-call weekends Limited number of paid holidays off Bundled vacation and sick leave PTO

review_title: Kline Galland is a great place to work
pros: The company cares about both the employees and patients. They have been very flexible with my schedule and my work needs. My coworkers are great team players who also care about patients.
cons: "Holidays" are limited and therefore have to use PTO for taking normal holidays off.

review_title: Tremendous support, professional and personal - Excellent work-life balance
pros: I always feel supported by managers and higher ups. No unrealistic expectations. Holiday party, cash bonuses, food trucks, coffee carts, raffle gifts, gift cards, PTO!
cons: Not allowed to wear jeans or tshirts as part of admin team.

job_title: Director of Community Partnerships in Seattle, WA
pros: Treatment of employees is excellent. Value of opinions Truly partnership values from the top down. Excellent place to work
cons: No Cons at this time even after 1 1/2 years of work

pros: The job hours are flexible and the staff are nice
cons: Sometimes the communication can be more efficient

pros: Excellent place to work. There is a strong focus on quality care for patients and employees are supported for good work/life balance.
